results.title: Below Beechworth
results.creator_credit: Kim Montgomery, Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Starting at the Burke Museum, local guide Dan Goonan, gives us a short history lesson about the gold rush days of Beechworth. We then follow Goonan as he takes us on a tour of the hidden underground tunnels which remain as a legacy of the Gold Rush. This film explores what lies below Beechworth, the parts you rarely see.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kim Montgomery, Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI

results.title: China tour
results.creator_credit: Si Tuan Lieng, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Si Tuan Lieng and his wife are retirees and have recently made an overseas trip to China. In this story he talks about his life and family, their integration into Australian society since they left Vietnam over 26 years ago and highlights of their holiday in China.

results.title: From Latvia to Beechworth : personal journeys
results.creator_credit: Kim Montgomery, Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Beate and Marta immigrated to Australia with their families, changing their lives for ever. Leaving behind their native Latvia both women struggled with acceptance, a new language, new customs and a foreign environment. This film showcases the strength, humour and humanity needed to survive and to flourish in a new land. Inga, her mother Beate and their friend Marta reflect on their lives and traditions, old and new.

results.title: Greta Craft Group
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, Matt Blackwood, ACMI Content Development, Shelley Matulick and ACMI
results.brief_description: Women come from great distances bringing their knitting needles, sewing machines and a good yarn to the weekly Greta Craft Group. The group was started by Kath White in the early 1990s when, as a young mum and new to the area, she reached out to other mums for some companionship. The group grew from there and became so popular they needed a waiting list for those interested to join - as Winifred Suffield suggests “craft is just an excuse to meet”. 2012 President Helen Bird and long time members Nola Jones and Julie White, speak about the support and friendship that the group has provided over decades. We hear the sounds of laughter and chatter as the ladies make all sorts of beautiful crafts which they provide to charities, both locally and internationally.

results.title: The Portland Star
results.creator_credit: David Meagher, Astrid Scott and ACMI
results.brief_description: Local residents and theatre workers talk about the positive impact the Portland Star has made on their lives and reminisce about “rolling Jaffas down the aisle”. Even though the theatre has seen changes over the years, in 2008 offering live music as a means to keep going, the proprietor expresses his passion for the cinema, even when it sometimes runs at a loss, and why he will continue to serve the community with great movies and live events.

results.title: An Interview with Major General Jim Hughes
results.brief_description: Major General Jim Hughes joined the army just after World War II. Army life suited him and he served as a platoon commander in Korea in the 1950s. He details one particularly long Sunday, during this time, when his company was ambushed by the Chinese and resulted in him maturing considerably in one day.

results.title: Shani
results.creator_credit: Kim Montgomery, David Withers, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Dynamic 18 year old Shani Aziz is a hip hop dancer living in the small town of Maldon where she runs the local fish and chip shop with her mother. She started hip hop dancing with her brother as something fun to do but it has become her passion leading her to start a not-for-profit group to empower young people. She is an inspirational teacher offering the youth of the small Victorian town an outlet for fun and self expression.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kim Montgomery, David Withers, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI

results.title: Sea Changers
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: More and more people are moving to Port Fairy to be part of a strong, creative and social community. We meet Katie Wise who came to Port Fairy for a visit, and has been there for 10 years now, managing the school canteen and teaching the kids the benefit of healthy food. For Helen and Ben Fennessy, Port Fairy is a place that gives them great solitude to be able to do what they like creatively. Judy and Victor Gillatt explored the town while on holiday in 1973, and the more they explored, the more they liked.

results.title: Castlemaine Community Lunch
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: The Castlemaine Community Lunch is a weekly event organised by the Castlemaine Community House. It brings people together in a warm and welcoming environment, encouraging and nurturing friendships and connections. Attended by locals, old and new, it is also a chance to welcome newcomers into the community.

results.title: On the Line
results.creator_credit: David Greig, John Richardson, Kestrel Films & Video (Australia) and SBS-TV
results.brief_description: It’s a harsh, lonely life for the men, mostly European migrants, who work maintaining the railway around Redmont in north-west Western Australia. Labouring through searing heat over 426 kilometres of mountainous, desert region, these men talk candidly about their lives, providing psychological and social insight into what it is to be living in “isolation”.
